body_html: The problem exists in general with all of IDEs that use Jedi as backend for Python completion right? And your solution will be general too or specific for PyCharm and VS Code? I use emacs with Jedi as completion backend and I have the same problem. BUT, what is interesting, you can try completion in IPython console and it works! It sees all the functions, how is that possible?

body: The problem exists in general with all of IDEs that use Jedi as backend for Python completion right? And your solution will be general too or specific for PyCharm and VS Code? I use emacs with Jedi as completion backend and I have the same problem. BUT, what is interesting, you can try completion in IPython console and it works! It sees all the functions, how is that possible?
